gr.interamerican.bo2.gui.listeners
Class RuntimeCommandContext

java.lang.Object
  gr.interamerican.bo2.gui.listeners.RuntimeCommandContext

public class RuntimeCommandContext
extends java.lang.Object

In applications that perform runtime commands on demand, such as web applications and swing UIs, it is useful to provide similar facilities to the ones provided by the RuntimeCommand for batch programs to the agent that is responsible for performing the runtime commands that are requested.

Such an agent will typically include code 

 RuntimeCommandContext.get().beginProcessing(); 

 try {
     ...
     RuntimeCommandContext.get().open(worker1);
     worker1.execute()
     ...
 } catch {
     RuntimeCommandContext.get().onException(ex);
 } finally {
     RuntimeCommandContext.get().endProcessing();
 }

This implementation supports multiple threads issuing runtime commands simultaneously. However, note that there is no provision for command queuing. Each thread that issues a command has to wait its completion before issuing a new one. TODO: move this to another bo2 project.

See Also:
Worker, RuntimeCommand

open

public static final <W extends Worker> W open(java.lang.Class<W> clazz)
Gets an open Worker object of a specified type. Any Exception thrown during the operation is wrapped inside a RuntimeException.

Type Parameters:
W - Type of worker defined by clazz.
Parameters:
clazz - Class of worker.
Returns:
Returns a new open instance of W.

openPw

public static final <P extends >  openPw(java.lang.Class<P> clazz)
